conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_B. Nursery_A is my first-choice nursery, and I would be very happy to enroll if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is Nursery_A, so I should apply there first. Although Nursery_A ranks me relatively low (4th), there is still a chance if higher-priority parents choose other nurseries. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before capacity is taken.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_B, thank you for your application and for ranking Nursery_A as your first choice. At this time, we are unable to offer you a place and must decline your application. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in securing a placement.
conversation.thought: Parent_B has applied to us and ranks 4th on our true priority list (E, D, A, B, C). We have quota 1 and only Parent_B in the inbox this round. However, higher-priority candidates (Parent_E, Parent_D, Parent_A) are likely to apply elsewhere first based on their preferences: Parent_D and Parent_A rank Nursery_A 3rd; Parent_E ranks Nursery_A 3rd. There is a meaningful chance one of them may come to us in later rounds if rejected by their top choices, so accepting Parent_B now would block us from matching with a higher-priority parent. Therefore, reject now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_C. Nursery_B is my top choice, and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a place. I would be happy to confirm promptly and provide any additional information you need. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Apply immediately to my top choice, Nursery_B. I have relatively strong priority there (ranked 3rd), so an early application maximizes my chance to secure the best possible match before higher-priority applicants potentially fill the single seat.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_C, thank you for your application and for sharing that Nursery_B is your top choice. I should not accept Parent_C immediately because I may be able to secure Parent_B or Parent_E in later rounds. Parent_E does not prefer Nursery_B (ranks it last), so unlikely. Parent_B ranks Nursery_B 2nd and may apply if not accepted by Nursery_A (their 1st). Nursery_A prioritizes Parent_E first, so Parent_B might be rejected there and then come to me. Therefore, I should reject Parent_C now to keep the slot open for Parent_B, while also rejecting lower-priority applicants separately. Risk: Parent_B could be accepted by Nursery_A; but given Nursery_A's priorities, Parent_E likely takes that spot if they apply. So holding is beneficial.
